intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium subpraevalidum, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cold, nutrient-poor environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. Hieracium subpraevalidum is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
